Resolved Question Show me another » Showing Picky eaters pictures of starving children? Would you consider show a child who is a Picky Eater pictures of Children Starving to death in other countries child abuse (I have never done this cause my Daughter is only 1 years old) I just wanted to find out how others feel about it 4 years ago Report Abuse
Additional Details LET ME CLARIFY MY DAUGHTER IS NOT A PICKY EATER I WAS JUST SIMPLY CURIOUS TO KNOW HOW OTHERS FEEL ABOUT IT 4 years ago by gyt Member since: September 01, 2008 Total points: 25,805 (Level 7) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Asker A young child won't make the connection. An older child will offer to send the dinner you made to Africa.
Here's what we did to solve our picky eaters. Serve them the food and give them time to eat it. If they don't, take the food and put it in the fridge. When they come back saying they are hungry and want a snack, heat the food back up and give it to them again. A child won't starve himself and will learn to eat.
We had one child that didn't like anything we served. So, I told him that he would be cooking dinner the next night. He complained that the only thing he knew how to do was put the tomatoes in the veggie dicer. (It's that kitchen gadget you see on tv where you put the item on the blade and then smash the lid down and the pieces fall in the cup. He was only 5. The next night all we had for dinner was diced tomatoes. He never complained again. 4 years ago Report Abuse

Other Answers (14) Show: All Answers Oldest to Newest Newest to Oldest Rated Highest to Lowest by asusan48 Member since: October 18, 2008 Total points: 1,691 (Level 3) Add Contact Block I don't think this would work. The child is not a picky eater because they want to be - sometimes it's just a matter of them simply not liking the foods they are offered. Some children refuse to eat vegetables or meats, some refuse to eat certain foods or casseroles. They will eventually outgrow their dislike of certain foods and start eating the majority of foods. (Note, I didn't say ALL foods, because everyone is an individual, and will retain a dislike for certain things their entire life!)
I have a picky eater myself, who will not eat ANY vegetables, and only recently started eating meats (other than hotdogs and chicken nuggets). I don't think showing him pictures of starving children would have any effect at all, other than to show him that there are starving children in the world. It wouldn't affect his eating habits at all. 4 years ago Report Abuse by Mama to 2006&2008 Member since: March 31, 2008 Total points: 12,210 (Level 6) Add Contact Block It depends on the age of the picky eater... If they're in upper elementary, then no, I'd consider it educational. If they're in preschool and it's done in a way that torments them or causes nightmares, then I'd say it's not the way to go. But then again, my response to picky eaters is to not offer anything special. I don't know any child who will truly starve themselves. Yes, they might go without a meal or two, but they'll just eat more at the next meal and once they know that they won't get something special no matter how much they whine or what fit they pitch, then it cuts down on the mealtime problems. Then again, I also believe in kids trying a bite of everything offered them and saying"I'd prefer more carrots, please"instead of"I hate that chicken, it's disgusting!" Source(s): Mom of two little ones and elementary teacher 4 years ago Report Abuse

realistically speaking the issues behind starvation among children have little to do with what your own child does or does not eat - it has far more to do with politics and distribution and NOTHING to do with something your own child has any control over 4 years ago Report Abuse by Olivia J Member since: November 14, 2007 Total points: 57,173 (Level 7) Add Contact Block I don't know if a young child would really make the connection - and the child may become extremely upset.
